title: Sacralize
tagline: Explore and harmonize with the universal principles of sacred geometry.
about_text: Sacralize is a platform for anyone curious about sacred geometry. Learn the patterns, principles, and history that connect the cosmos to our daily lives.
feature_1_desc: Step-by-step guides to help you understand sacred geometry and its applications.
feature_2_desc: Generate and explore patterns like the Flower of Life, Fibonacci spirals, and more.
feature_3_desc: Connect with others, share designs, and inspire creativity.
cta_text: Dive into tutorials, generate patterns, and connect with a global community.

about.title: About Sacralize
about.mission: To make people aware of the beauty and interconnectedness of existence and to empower them to use these principles for the benefit of all.
about.team_description: Sacralize is brought to you by Björn Kenneth Holmström, with the assistance of Claude 3.5 Sonnet and ChatGPT 4o.
about.vision_description: We don’t have a detailed vision yet, but we are looking forward to a prosperous future.
about.faqs_placeholder: We are currently compiling common questions. Stay tuned!

toolkit.title: Toolkit
toolkit.overview: Explore our available tools to unlock the potential of sacred geometry.
toolkit.layout_tool_desc: An interactive canvas for designing your own sacred geometry layouts.
toolkit.export_desc: Download your patterns and designs as high-quality images.

basics.title: Basics of Sacred Geometry
basics.intro_content: Sacred geometry explores the universal patterns and shapes that form the foundation of existence. Dive into its origins, key concepts, and famous examples to understand how these principles connect art, nature, and spirituality.
basics.what_is_description: Learn about the foundational principles of sacred geometry and its significance in understanding the interconnectedness of all things.
basics.history_description: Delve into the origins of sacred geometry and its influence across cultures, from ancient civilizations to modern times.
basics.examples_description: Discover famous examples of sacred geometry, including the Flower of Life, the Great Pyramid of Giza, and more.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: Sacred geometry reveals the mathematical principles that govern the natural world, from the microscopic to the cosmic scale. These universal patterns serve as the building blocks of reality, appearing consistently throughout nature, art, architecture, and even music.

patterns.title: Patterns in Nature
patterns.description: Nature consistently demonstrates sacred geometric principles through various patterns:

hexagonal.title: Hexagonal Efficiency
hexagonal.description: Honeybees construct their combs using perfect hexagons, creating the most efficient structure for storing honey while using minimal materials. This same hexagonal pattern appears in giant's causeway basalt columns and snowflakes.

golden_spiral.title: The Golden Spiral
golden_spiral.description: Found in the nautilus shell, this logarithmic spiral follows the Fibonacci sequence and the golden ratio (φ ≈ 1.618). This proportion appears throughout nature, from the arrangement of leaves on plants (phyllotaxis) to the spiral arms of galaxies.

fractals.title: Fractal Patterns
fractals.description: From fern fronds to romanesco broccoli, fractals show how simple mathematical rules can create complex, self-similar patterns that repeat at different scales.

ancient.title: Ancient Understanding
ancient.description: These patterns didn't go unnoticed by our ancestors. Ancient civilizations worldwide recognized these recurring designs:

examples.egyptian: Egyptian pyramids incorporated the golden ratio in their proportions
examples.greek: Greek temples used precise geometric ratios to create harmonious structures
examples.islamic: Islamic architecture developed complex geometric patterns based on mathematical principles
examples.eastern: Buddhist and Hindu mandalas demonstrate radial symmetry and sacred proportions

modern.title: Modern Applications
modern.description: Today, these ancient principles find new life in:
modern.conclusion: Understanding sacred geometry helps us recognize the mathematical order underlying natural phenomena and shows us how to apply these principles in our own creative endeavors.

key_concepts.title: Key Concepts
key_concepts.description: Sacred geometry is built upon fundamental principles that show how simple shapes and ratios create complex patterns found throughout the universe.

unity.title: Unity
unity.description: The circle represents unity and wholeness, the starting point of all geometric forms. It symbolizes infinity, completeness, and the cyclical nature of existence.
unity.examples: Found in: the sun, full moon, mandalas, and the iris of the eye.
unity.mathematical: A circle is defined by points equidistant from a center, creating perfect symmetry in all directions.

duality.title: Duality
duality.description: The division of unity into two parts represents the fundamental pairs found in nature: light/dark, male/female, active/passive.
duality.examples: Expressed in: day and night cycles, binary systems, and magnetic poles.
duality.mathematical: The vesica piscis, formed by two overlapping circles, creates the foundation for many sacred geometric patterns.

trinity.title: Trinity
trinity.description: Three represents creation and growth. The triangle is the first and simplest polygon, embodying stability and dynamic force.
trinity.examples: Seen in: pyramids, molecular structures, and religious symbolism.
trinity.mathematical: Triangles are the strongest structural shape, distributing force evenly across all sides.

golden_ratio.title: The Golden Ratio (φ)
golden_ratio.description: A special number approximately equal to 1.618033988749895 that creates aesthetically pleasing proportions found throughout nature and art.
golden_ratio.significance: The golden ratio represents the perfect balance between symmetry and asymmetry, growth and constraint.

ratios_proportions.title: Sacred Ratios and Proportions
ratios_proportions.description: Beyond the golden ratio, several other proportions appear consistently in sacred geometry:

square_root.title: Square Root Proportions
square_root.description: √2, √3, √5 ratios found in sacred architecture and musical harmony

musical.title: Musical Ratios
musical.description: Simple whole number ratios (2:3, 3:4, 4:5) that create musical intervals and harmony

fibonacci.title: Fibonacci Sequence
fibonacci.description: 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13... Each number is the sum of the previous two, approaching the golden ratio

ratios_proportions.significance: These ratios create visual harmony and resonate with natural patterns of growth and organization.
ratios_proportions.modern_use: Modern designers and architects use these proportions to create aesthetically pleasing and harmonious compositions.

practical_applications.title: Practical Applications
practical_applications.description: Sacred geometry's principles continue to influence modern design and creation across multiple disciplines.

architecture.title: Architecture & Urban Planning
architecture.description: Sacred geometry principles guide the creation of harmonious and sustainable spaces:
examples: Sustainable building design using natural proportions
Urban planning with sacred geometry grid systems
Energy-efficient structures based on geometric principles

digital_design.title: Digital Design & User Interface
digital_design.description: Modern digital interfaces benefit from sacred geometric principles:
examples: Website layouts using golden ratio proportions
User experience patterns based on natural movement

art_music.title: Art & Music
art_music.description: Creative expressions enhanced by sacred geometry:
examples: Dance choreography based on geometric forms
Sacred geometry in contemporary art installations

product_design.title: Product Design
examples: Package design with sacred geometry principles

conclusion.title: Moving Forward with Sacred Geometry
conclusion.description: Understanding and applying sacred geometry principles can enhance any creative or design process, creating work that resonates with the natural patterns of life and consciousness.

introduction.title: Origins and Evolution
introduction.description: Sacred geometry's history spans thousands of years, crossing cultural boundaries and influencing civilizations worldwide. From ancient megalithic structures to modern architecture, these universal patterns have shaped human understanding of the cosmos.
introduction.significance: Throughout history, sacred geometry has been more than mathematical principles—it has been a bridge between the physical and spiritual realms, helping cultures understand and represent the fundamental patterns of creation.

ancient_egypt.title: Ancient Egypt (c. 2700 BCE)
ancient_egypt.description: Egyptian civilization mastered geometric principles, as evidenced in:
achievements: The precise alignment and proportions of the Great Pyramids
The use of the Golden Ratio in temple architecture
Development of practical geometry for land surveying
Integration of cosmic alignments in architectural design

ancient_greece.title: Ancient Greece (c. 600 BCE)
ancient_greece.description: Greek philosophers and mathematicians formalized geometric principles:
achievements: Pythagoras's discoveries of musical harmony through geometry
Development of geometric proofs and theories
Application in classical architecture and art

islamic_golden_age.title: Islamic Golden Age (c. 800 CE)
islamic_golden_age.description: Islamic scholars and artists advanced geometric patterns:
achievements: Development of complex geometric patterns in art
Integration of geometry with religious architecture
Preservation and advancement of ancient geometric knowledge

renaissance.title: Renaissance (c. 1500 CE)
renaissance.description: European revival of classical geometric principles:
achievements: Leonardo da Vinci's studies of proportion
Integration of sacred geometry in religious art
Architectural innovations based on geometric principles

cultural_expressions.title: Cultural Expressions
cultural_expressions.description: Different cultures have interpreted and applied sacred geometry in unique ways:

egyptian.title: Egyptian Expression
egyptian.description: Focused on cosmic alignment and perfect proportions in monumental architecture.

islamic.title: Islamic Expression
islamic.description: Developed intricate geometric patterns to express divine infinity and unity.

hindu_buddhist.title: Hindu/Buddhist Expression
hindu_buddhist.description: Created mandalas as geometric representations of the cosmos and consciousness.

modern_understanding.title: Modern Understanding
modern_understanding.description: Today's perspective on sacred geometry combines:
aspects: Application in contemporary design and architecture
Integration with digital tools and technology
modern_understanding.significance: Modern studies have revealed the mathematical precision of ancient builders and the universal nature of geometric principles across cultures.

introduction.title: Timeless Manifestations
introduction.description: Throughout history, sacred geometry has been expressed in some of humanity's most remarkable architectural and artistic achievements. These examples demonstrate how universal mathematical principles can create structures of enduring beauty and significance.

great_pyramid.title: The Great Pyramid of Giza
great_pyramid.description: Built around 2560 BCE, the Great Pyramid embodies sacred geometric principles in its very structure.

features.title: Key Geometric Features
items: Pi (π) relationship between height and perimeter
Golden ratio (φ) in its triangular faces
Perfect square base with remarkable precision

significance.title: Mathematical Significance
significance.description: The pyramid's dimensions demonstrate an advanced understanding of geometry and mathematical constants, including:

flower_of_life.title: The Flower of Life
flower_of_life.description: A fundamental pattern found across numerous ancient cultures, the Flower of Life contains multiple layers of sacred geometric significance.

construction.title: Pattern Construction
steps: Add six identical circles around it

meanings.title: Symbolic Meanings
items: Fundamental patterns of space and time

parthenon.title: The Parthenon
parthenon.description: Built in the 5th century BCE, the Parthenon exemplifies the Greek mastery of proportion and harmony.

proportions.title: Golden Proportions
proportions.description: The Parthenon's dimensions follow the golden ratio in multiple ways:

influence.title: Architectural Influence
influence.description: The Parthenon's geometric principles continue to influence:

modern_relevance.title: Modern Relevance
modern_relevance.description: These ancient examples continue to inform and inspire contemporary design and architecture.

tools.title: Sacred Geometry Tools
tools.intro_content: Our tools are designed to help you create, explore, and learn about sacred geometry. Dive into pattern generators, interactive design tools, and more.
tools.flower_of_life_description: Generate the intricate and beautiful Flower of Life pattern, a foundational element in sacred geometry.
tools.fibonacci_description: Create stunning Fibonacci spirals and explore the connection between mathematics and nature.
tools.custom_shapes_description: Design your own shapes and patterns with this interactive and flexible tool.
tools.sacred_geometry_description: Tools for exploring sacred geometry: Vesica Piscis, Polygons, Golden Ratio and Sacred Proportions.

flower_of_life.title: Flower of Life Generator
flower_of_life.description: Create and customize the sacred Flower of Life pattern, a fundamental symbol of sacred geometry found throughout nature and ancient architecture.

customize.title: Customize Your Pattern
customize.description: Adjust the number of rings, size, and colors to create your perfect Flower of Life pattern.

experiment.title: Experiment with Guides
experiment.description: Toggle guide lines to understand the construction and underlying geometry of the pattern.

save.title: Save Your Creation
save.description: Download your design as an SVG file for use in other projects or for printing.

learn_more.title: Learn More About the Flower of Life
learn_more.description: The Flower of Life is one of the most significant sacred geometric patterns, representing the fundamental forms of space and time.

symbolism.title: Symbolic Meaning
points: Represents the cycle of creation and cosmic order
Contains all five Platonic solids within its pattern
Symbolizes the interconnectedness of all life
Found in ancient cultures worldwide

applications.title: Modern Applications
points: Architectural design and sacred spaces
Energy healing and meditation
Art and decorative design
Product packaging and branding

fibonacci_spiral.title: Fibonacci Spiral Generator
fibonacci_spiral.description: Create and explore the golden spiral based on the Fibonacci sequence, a pattern found throughout nature and art.

comparison.title: Fibonacci vs Golden Spiral
comparison.description: While the Fibonacci spiral closely approximates the golden spiral, they're not exactly the same. The golden spiral is a true logarithmic spiral based on φ (phi, the golden ratio), while the Fibonacci spiral is constructed from quarter-circles.

differences.construction: The Fibonacci spiral is made of quarter-circles, while the golden spiral is smooth throughout
differences.growth: The golden spiral grows by a constant factor for each quarter turn (exactly φ), while the Fibonacci spiral's growth rate varies slightly
differences.approximation: As the numbers get larger, the Fibonacci spiral becomes an increasingly better approximation of the golden spiral

iterations.title: Adjust Iterations
iterations.description: More iterations create a larger, more detailed spiral pattern.

visualization.title: Visualization Options
visualization.description: Toggle numbers and grid to understand the mathematical relationships.

interaction.title: Interactive Features
interaction.description: Rotate the spiral and try different color schemes to explore the pattern.

learn_more.title: About the Fibonacci Spiral
learn_more.description: The Fibonacci spiral is created by drawing circular arcs connecting the opposite corners of squares with sides of lengths following the Fibonacci sequence.

mathematical.title: Mathematical Properties
points: Based on the Fibonacci sequence: 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13...
Approximates the golden spiral
Each number is the sum of the previous two
Ratio between consecutive numbers approaches φ (≈ 1.618034)

golden_ratio.title: Connection to the Golden Ratio
points: The golden ratio (φ) is approximately 1.618034
Consecutive Fibonacci numbers approach this ratio
The golden spiral grows by φ every quarter turn
Found throughout nature and classical architecture

natural.title: Natural Occurrences
points: Nautilus shells and spiral galaxies
Arrangement of leaves on plants
Flower petals and seed heads
Hurricane formations

custom_shapes.title: Custom Shapes Tool
custom_shapes.description: Create and combine basic geometric shapes to explore sacred geometry principles and create your own designs.

basics.title: Basic Controls
basics.description: Click to place shapes, drag to move them. Use the controls to adjust size, rotation, and colors.

layers.title: Working with Layers
layers.description: Arrange your shapes using the layer controls. Select multiple shapes by holding Shift while clicking.

shortcuts.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
shortcuts.description: Use keyboard shortcuts for quick actions like duplicating (Ctrl/Cmd + D) and deleting (Delete) shapes.

learn_more.title: Understanding Shape Relationships
learn_more.description: Sacred geometry is built upon the relationships between basic shapes and their proportions.

principles.title: Geometric Principles
points: Every complex pattern begins with simple shapes
The relationship between shapes creates meaning
Sacred ratios emerge from shape combinations
Symmetry and balance guide sacred geometry

applications.title: Creative Applications
points: Design personal mandalas and sacred symbols
Create patterns for meditation and focus
Explore geometric art principles
Develop unique sacred geometry compositions
